blogData.title: Patch Notes: May 2019
blogData.description:
Patch Notes for May 2019: (a) Upload Bug, (b) Naming Convention Enhancement,
  (c) Timing Bug, (d) Help Bug
blogData.keywords: ai transcription, ai translation, ai dubbing, product update video translator, product update video translation, value proposition video transcriber, value proposition video translator, traction video transcriber, traction video translator, use case video transcriber, use case video translator, youtube subtitles, video caption, youtube captions

data.richContent:
There are a number of bug fixes and patches, which may affect your user experience. Fixes include (a) and upload bug, (b) a naming convention enhancement, Â© a UI timing bug, (d) UI help bug, and (e) UI folder bug.

May 2019: Upload Bug

Previously, if you uploaded certain files, and exceeded certain file sizes, the application would error without notifying the user.

Specifically, on the operational side, we setup all client with file and size permissions at enrolment. In the below, *.bmp was removed from the image list, and *.mov was added to the video list.

  • Generic: *.pdf only, maximum 100mb.
  • Image Files: *.png, *.gif, *.jpg, and *.jepg only, maximum 100mb.
  • Audio Files: *.mp3 only, maximum of 100mb.
  • Video Files: *.mp4, *.avi, and *.mov only, maximum 250mb.

The error handler had a bug so the failure would error out and not be communicated to the user. This has now been addressed with the bottom-centred snack-bar and message.

May 2019: Naming Convention Enhancement

Previously, on uploading assets, the asset would be rename to include a unique identification code which would be reflected in the name. This has been improved upon, and now the asset names should not include special characters, and are mostly transparent to users.

The only difference is the extra characters at the start of the asset have been removed.

May 2019: Timing Bug

Previously, there used to be a bug where changing the times within the *.srt files would cause the application to crash. There was a bug regression, and this bug showed up again. This has now been fixed.

Should you believe you are seeing this issue, please contact us so we can address it. The workaround was to highlight and replace the character (when the bug was not patched).

May 2019: Help Bug

Previously, on first load of the application, the help modal (clicking on the question mark icon) would get cut off at the bottom of the screen. Exiting the modal and reopening the modal would solve this issue.

Conclusion

Please connect with us on LinkedIn, YouTube or Facebook for any comments, questions, or just to keep up to date with the work we do!

We are very grateful for your support!

If you are interested in trying out our technology, please try our platform, or drop us an email at hello@videotranslator.ai.

nodes.title: Bridging Languages, Unleashing Global Potential: Introducing Our New Website and App
nodes.description: Discover our website and app, with native multilingual support and powerful transcription, translation, and voiceover capabilities in 120 languages.
nodes.coverAlt: Bridging Languages, Unleashing Global Potential: Introducing Our New Website and App

nodes.title: What Team VideoTranslator Did In 2021
nodes.description: 2021 was a bit of a complex year. As I'm sure it was for many of you. Read more to learn about how Team VideoTranslator navigated 2021.

nodes.title: Merry Christmas!
nodes.description: As we close down 2021, we would like to wish everyone a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year. Thank you for your support this year!
